behavior.name: response-format
behavior.summary: Defines the standard response format for all agents during orchestration. Every message must be prefixed with the current lifecycle context so humans can track what phase is active during complex orchestrations.
behavior.definition:
Every response during conversation or execution MUST begin with a lifecycle prefix:
LIFECYCLE: {lifecycle-name} // {message}
Examples: LIFECYCLE: {current-phase} // Created ticket sp-04a: "Add logout button". LIFECYCLE: {current-phase} // Launching explorer agent to build codebase context. LIFECYCLE: {current-phase} // 3/5 teammates complete. Waiting on sub-task 4 (auth module). LIFECYCLE: {current-phase} // Doc scout found 2 files needing updates. Launching auditors. LIFECYCLE: {current-phase} // Draft PR ready for review.
When blocked at a human gate: LIFECYCLE: {lifecycle-name} // BLOCKED — waiting for your approval to proceed.
behavior.rule: Every single response uses this format — no exceptions
The lifecycle name must match the phase currently being executed
Sub-agents reporting back to the orchestrator include their role in the message
Before any active work phase begins (e.g. initial greeting), use LIFECYCLE: IDLE
